intro: Alsodeiopsis laurentii, commonly known as the narrowleaf alsodeiopsis, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, with a hairy texture. Alsodeiopsis laurentii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
